alert.description: Any message text returned by Claude.

pages.description: An array of the form questions in the image. A question typically consists of a question title, some optional hint text and one or more form fields. Form fields typically look like boxes. If the image contains no form fields it's an information page and you should set the answer_settings to information_page and add the contents of the page to the information item.

id.description: The number of the question. If the questions in the image don't have numbers, number them sequentially, starting at 1.

question_text.description: The title of the question. Questions titles are often bigger or bolder than the surrounding text.

hint_text.description: Any hint text associated with the question. It often appears immediately below the question title, in a smaller or lighter font. An example of hint text is 'Tick the box or boxes that apply'

needs_routing.description: True if any part of the question contains text like 'Go to page' or 'Go to question'

answer_type.description: The type of question being asked, based on the fields. If there are no form fields, it's not a question it's an information page and the content should be converted to the Markdown syntax. If it's a large box for writing multiple lines of text, it's a text_area. If any part of the question contains text like 'Tick the boxes...' it's a multiple_choice question. If any part of the question contains text like 'Tick one box' it's a single_choice' question. If a question contains square boxes it's a multiple_choice question. If it's asking how many of something there is, it's a number question.

input_type.description: The specific form field type for this question

information.description: If the answer_type is information_page, return the contents here in Markdown syntax. Remember to use double line breaks between paragraphs. List item bullets should be rendered as * not â€¢.

options.description: If the answer_type is single_choice or multiple_choice, list the options here. Only give options that appear in the original image, do not make any up. There should be the same number of options as boxes or circles. Phrases like 'Tick the box' are never options.
